(1) Where a person has subscribed for of a acting on any statement included, or the inclusion or omission of any matter, in the which is misleading and has sustained any loss or damage as a consequence thereof, the company and every person who— ( a ) is a of the company at the time of the issue of the prospectus; ( b ) has authorised himself to be named and is named in the prospectus as a director of the company, or has agreed to become such director, either immediately or after an interval of time; ( c ) is a of the company; ( d ) has authorised the issue of the prospectus; and ( e ) is an referred to in sub-section (5) of section 26, shall, without prejudice to any punishment to which any person may be liable under section 36, be liable to pay compensation to every person who has sustained such loss or damage.(Effective from 01.04.2014) (2) No person shall be liable under sub-section (1), if he proves— ( a ) that, having consented to become a director of the company, he withdrew his consent before the issue of the prospectus, and that it was issued without his authority or consent; or ( b ) that the prospectus was issued without his knowledge or consent, and that on becoming aware of its issue, he forthwith gave a reasonable public notice that it was issued without his knowledge or consent. that, as regards every misleading statement purported to be made by an expert or contained in what purports to be a copy of or an extract from a report or valuation of an expert, it was a correct and fair representation of the statement, or a correct copy of, or a correct and fair extract from, the report or valuation; and he had reasonable ground to believe and did up to the time of the issue of the prospectus believe, that the person making the statement was competent to make it and that the said person had given the consent required by sub-section (5) of section 26 to the issue of the prospectus and had not withdrawn that consent before delivery of a copy of the prospectus for registration or, to the defendant’s knowledge, before allotment thereunder. act_summary: This section addresses the liability of individuals who have subscribed for securities and sustained losses due to misleading statements in prospectuses. It applies to directors, promoters, experts, and persons authorised by them or named in the prospectus. Liability is limited except where proven that the prospectus was issued with intent to defraud.
